Unpacking nested lists of indefinite depth¶

unpacking_flatten_lists.funcs.niccolum_flatten(array: Iterable) → List¶

Non recursive algorithm Based on pop/insert elements in current list

unpacking_flatten_lists.funcs.recursion_flatten(arr: Iterable) → Iterator¶

Recursive algorithm based on iterator Usual solution to this problem

unpacking_flatten_lists.funcs.recursive_flatten_like_tishka(array: Iterable) → List¶

Recursive algorithm Based on tishka_flatten algorithm

unpacking_flatten_lists.funcs.tishka_flatten(data: Iterable) → List¶

Non recursive algorithm Based on append/extend elements to new list

unpacking_flatten_lists.funcs.tishka_flatten_with_stack(seq: Iterable) → List¶

Non recursive algorithm Based on zart_flatten, but build on try/except pattern

unpacking_flatten_lists.funcs.zart_flatten(a: Iterable) → List¶

Non recursive algorithm Based on pop from old and append elements to new list
